newsitem.title: RUSSIA: PRESS DIGEST - RUSSIA IZVESTIA - MAY 16.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - RUSSIA IZVESTIA - MAY 16.

text.p: The following are some of the leading stories in the May 17 edition of Russia's Izvestia newspaper. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- It is difficult to live in a country where nearly the entire population is entitled to social benefits, because it leaves no one to provide these benefits.
- The energy crisis in Russia's Far East has turned into an economic and political one, and threatens to become an open confrontation with authorities.
- A fragment of the Russian Amber Chamber discovered in Germany has put official Moscow in a difficult position in the heated debate over the trophy art law.
- Russia's First Deputy Prime Minister Anatoly Chubais's intensive talks with regional leaders are aimed at redistributing the budget and tax load between regions and the federal centre.
- Communists elected to local legislatures are preparing for the second advent of the Communist Party in the country.
